rules: Rule1: If worker1 has clearance for lab_alpha, then worker1 is safe for operations.
Rule2: Whenever worker1 fails screening, then worker1 passes screening.
Rule3: Provided that worker1 is assigned the job of drug_synthesis, worker1 is safe for operations.
Rule4: If worker1 is diagnosed with a plant_allergy, then worker1 is assigned the job of drug_synthesis.
Rule5: Under the condition that worker1 is cleared for work, worker1 is suspended from work.
Rule6: Either manager1 conducts a supervisor review of worker1 or compliance1 conducts a safety audit of worker1.

Rule7: Should compliance1 conduct a safety audit of worker1, then if the implication from exposure to toxic_plant to the absence of contamination with pathogen_x does not hold, worker1 does not show symptoms.
Rule8: If lab_alpha has conflicting reports regarding worker1, then worker1 has confirmed exposure to pathogen_x.

Rule9: Either lab_alpha has conflicting reports regarding worker1 or, in case manager1 conducts a supervisor review of worker1, then if the implication from exposure to toxic_plant to the absence of contamination with pathogen_x is false, worker1 does not show symptoms.
Rule10: If security1 has an investigation open for worker1, then should lab_alpha have conflicting reports regarding worker1, it is not the case that worker1 has confirmed exposure to pathogen_x.
Rule11: Either worker1 has temporary clearance or worker1 does not have contamination with pathogen_x.
Rule12: Worker1 has permanent clearance or worker1 does not have temporary clearance.
Rule13: Worker1 has restricted access or worker1 does not have permanent clearance.
Rule14: If doctor1 conducts a medical evaluation of worker1, then worker1 does not have restricted access.
Rule15: Doctor1 conducts a medical evaluation of worker1 or safety1 conducts a safety assessment of worker1.
Rule16: Provided that worker1 has authorization for plant_research, then worker1 has approved access to the greenhouse.
Rule17: Worker1 has authorization for plant_research or worker1 does not have contamination with pathogen_x.
Rule18: Either director1 gives management approval for worker1 or compliance1 gives compliance approval for worker1.
Rule19: If compliance1 gives compliance approval for worker1, then should safety1 conduct a safety assessment of worker1, worker1 does not have restricted access.
Rule20: In the event that worker1 has emergency access, then worker1 does not have special permission.
Rule21: If director1 gives research director clearance for worker1, then worker1 has authorized access to plant_lab.
Rule22: Either director1 gives research director clearance for worker1 or supervisor1 gives technical supervisor clearance for worker1.
Rule23: Whenever supervisor1 gives technical supervisor clearance for worker1, then worker1 does not have authorization for plant_research.
Rule24: Should worker1 follow the decontamination protocol, then worker1 is safe for operations.
Rule25: Worker1 follows the decontamination protocol or worker1 bypasses the decontamination protocol.
Rule26: Provided that worker1 has passed screening, then worker1 has completed screening.
Rule27: If it is not the case that exposure to toxic_plant implies the absence of contamination with pathogen_x, then worker1 shows symptoms.
Rule28: Whenever it is not true that authorization for plant_research implies the absence of approved access to the greenhouse, then worker1 needs quarantine.
Rule29: If the implication from authorization for plant_research to the absence of approved access to the greenhouse does not hold, then worker1 does not need quarantine.
Rule30: Should the implication from management approval by director1 to full reinstatement be invalid, then worker1 has special permission.
Rule31: If the implication from management approval by director1 to full reinstatement is false, then worker1 has emergency access.
Rule32: Should the implication from bypassing the decontamination protocol to being safe for operations be invalid, then worker1 has not completed screening.
Rule33: If the implication from the negation of the bypass protocol implication to failed screening is not true, then worker1 has been granted an exception.
Rule34: Provided that the implication from not being diagnosed with plant_allergy to not requiring medication is invalid, then worker1 is cleared for work.
Rule35: If worker1 does not have clearance for lab_alpha, then worker1 has contamination with pathogen_x.
Rule36: Whenever worker1 is not diagnosed with a plant_allergy, then worker1 requires medication.
facts: Fact1: Worker1 is exposed to a toxic_plant.
Fact2: Security1 has an investigation open for worker1.
Fact3: It is not the case that worker1 has been granted an exception.
Fact4: Worker1 is not suspended from work.
Fact5: Worker1 does not have full reinstatement.
Fact6: Worker1 does not have authorized access to plant_lab.
